definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail

sentences.english: Then decline tone, she is a big mouth to fight over.
sentences.chinese: 話沒落音，她就是一個大嘴巴打過來。

sentences.english: Your mummy is frog, she has two big eyes, one big mouth.
sentences.chinese: 你的媽媽是青蛙，她有兩隻大眼睛，一隻大嘴巴。

sentences.english: Yawn publicly with an open mouth, indicating boredom.
sentences.chinese: 在公共場所，張大嘴巴連連打呵欠，顯示你極度厭倦。

sentences.english: Ann has a big mouth, you can't trust her with any secrets.
sentences.chinese: 安是個大嘴巴，你什麼祕密都不能跟她講。

sentences.english: Everyone is opening up its big mouth and waiting for the delicious food.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都開放它的大嘴巴等待美味的食物。

sentences.english: I have two small eyes, a small nose and a very big mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我有一雙小眼睛，一個小鼻子和一個大嘴巴。

sentences.english: Don't tell Peggy anything confidential; she's known for having a big mouth.
sentences.chinese: 別告訴瑪吉任何機密的事情，她的大嘴巴是出了名的。

sentences.english: Gees , my roommate is such a big mouth!
sentences.chinese: 天啊，我的室友真是一個大嘴巴。

sentences.english: As soon as a small nose, with publicizes the mouth.
sentences.chinese: 一個小鼻子，和一張大嘴巴。

sentences.english: Guide the Number Muncher to all the prime numbers.
sentences.chinese: 引導數字大嘴巴到所有的質數。

sentences.english: That Mrs. Bigmouth has about as much tact as a bull in a china shop.
sentences.chinese: 那爲大嘴巴太太說話跟闖進瓷器店的公牛一樣笨拙。

sentences.english: She is such a gossip. I will never tell her anything ever again.
sentences.chinese: 她實存是個大嘴巴，我再也不會告訴她任何事情了。

sentences.english: I have big eyes, an aquiline nose and a big mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我有一雙大眼睛，一個高挺的鼻子和一張大嘴巴。

sentences.english: The outspoken cabinet member was sidelined by the President.
sentences.chinese: 因爲大嘴巴，總統就讓這位內閣成員歇菜了。

sentences.english: Look, above is a toad opening its mouth to eat a swan.
sentences.chinese: 上面有一隻懶蛤蟆，它張大嘴巴想喫天鵝肉。

sentences.english: Number Munchers are games to play with arithmetic.
sentences.chinese: 數字大嘴巴是有關算術的遊戲。

definition: (coll.) a slap on one's face/a cuff
mouth/CL:張|张[zhang1]/slap in the face/CL:個|个[ge4]
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
a slap on the face/CL:記|记[ji4]
crow's beak/(fig.) person who makes an inauspicious remark
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
Shut up!/same as 閉上嘴巴|闭上嘴巴
talkative/to speak out of turn/to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/rumors fly
